actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to reduce unemployment by providing that unemployment insurance funds may be used pursuant to State laws establishing programs for payments to employers who hire the unemployed.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 and the Social Security Act to allow Federal unemployment insurance tax funds to be used in State programs for payments to employers who hire the unemployed. Sets forth requirements for State-approved plans and the administration of such plans in such State programs.

titles.title: A bill to reduce unemployment by providing that unemployment insurance funds may be used pursuant to State laws establishing programs for payments to employers who hire the unemployed.
